author: Staff reports
title: Devils can't hold off Pirates
text:
The Portland Pirates scored four unanswered goals and rallied past the Albany Devils 4-2 on Friday evening at Cross Insurance Arena in Portland, Maine.
Portland moved to 3-1-0-0. Albany fell to 1-2-1-0.
Paul Thompson cleaned up a rebound and scored to put Albany up 1-0 at 8:10 of the opening period.
With 45 seconds remaining in the first period, Devils rookie Blake Pietila scored on a breakaway to provide the visitors a 2-0 advantage.
Portland responded with two goals in the second period.
John McFarland got the hosts on the board at 12:05 and Greg McKegg evened the game three minutes later.
McKegg broke the 2-2 tie 28 seconds into the third period and scored the game's final goal, an empty-net, power-play tally, at 19:14.
Albany goalie Doug Carr made his Devils debut and stopped 23 shots. Former Albany goalie Mike McKenna earned his second win and made 26 stops.
Portland and Albany will meet in the Devils' home opener at 5 p.m. Saturday at Times Union Center.
